title: 110_hr1407
content:
The Act titled "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" expands the deduction for interest on education loans. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the phaseout beginning point for the deduction under section 221. The deduction amount is reduced based on the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income, with specific thresholds for singles and joint filers. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the phaseout beginning point for the deduction under section 221. The deduction amount is reduced based on the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income, with specific thresholds for singles and joint filers. The amendments also include adjustments to the $100,000 and $200,000 amounts in subsection (b) for taxable years beginning after 2008. The amendments made by this section increase the phaseout beginning point for the deduction under section 221 in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The changes apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2007. SEC. 3. Deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses made permanent. Repeal of termination of Section 222 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Effective date for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2007.

SEC. 4. Education savings accounts. Increase in allowable contributions to $5,000. Reports to be filed by June 30 of the following year. Effective date for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2007. SEC. 5. Allowance of room, board, and special needs services for scholarships and tuition reduction programs in higher education. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code allows for qualified higher education expenses at eligible educational institutions. Additionally, tuition reduction programs are modified to exclude the phrase "(below the graduate level)" and substitute it with provisions for qualified higher education. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code allows for qualified higher education expenses at eligible educational institutions. The amendments made by this section shall apply to expenses paid after December 31, 2007 for education furnished in academic periods beginning after such date. Expansion of educational expenses allowed as part of Hope Scholarship Credit. Expansion of qualified tuition and related expenses for the Hope Scholarship Credit to include fees, books, supplies, and equipment required for courses at eligible educational institutions. The Hope Scholarship Credit will not be reduced by Federal Pell Grants or Supplemental Educational Opportunity Grants. The amendment expands qualified tuition expenses for the Hope Scholarship Credit to include fees, books, supplies, and equipment. Federal Pell Grants and Supplemental Educational Opportunity Grants will not reduce the credit. The amendments apply to expenses paid after December 31, 2007, for education in academic periods starting after that date. Title IX of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 will not be subject to the sunset provisions for subtitles A, B, and D of title IV of the Act.
